text.name: TextDescLong
text.text: The Tomy Tutor is a home computer produced by the Japanese toymaker Tomy. It was architecturally similar, but not identical, to the TI-99/4A, and used a similar Texas Instruments 16-bit CPU. The computer was launched in Japan in 1982, and in the UK and the United States in the next year.
